descriptions: Claim is missing, unclear, or irrelevant to the topic.
Claim is vaguely stated and lacks focus; connection to the topic is tenuous.
Claim is identifiable but could be more precise; some connection to the topic.
Claim is clearly stated and relevant, but could benefit from further refinement.
Claim is precise, focused, and clearly relevant to the topic; alternate claims are mentioned.
Claim is exceptionally clear, precise, and directly relevant; skillfully distinguishes the claim from alternate or opposing claims.
No attempt to develop claims or counterclaims.
Arguments and counterclaims are presented without supporting evidence or data.
Arguments and counterclaims are present, but evidence is weak or not discipline-appropriate.
Arguments and counterclaims are developed with some evidence, but strengths and limitations are not clearly addressed.
Arguments and counterclaims are fairly developed with relevant data and evidence; strengths and limitations are acknowledged.
Arguments and counterclaims are expertly developed with strong, discipline-appropriate evidence; skillfully addresses strengths and limitations while considering audience.
No transitions used; writing lacks cohesion.
Transitions are minimal and ineffective; writing is disjointed.
Transitions are present but do not always clarify relationships between ideas.
Transitions are used to connect sections, but cohesion could be improved.
Transitions effectively link major sections and clarify relationships between claims, reasons, and evidence.
Transitions are seamless and enhance the flow of the text; expertly creates cohesion and clarifies complex relationships.
Writing lacks formal style and objective tone; inappropriate for academic context.
Style is inconsistent; tone is subjective or biased.
Style is somewhat formal, but tone occasionally lapses into subjectivity.
Maintains a generally formal style and objective tone, with minor inconsistencies.
Consistently maintains a formal style and objective tone appropriate for the discipline.
Exemplary use of formal style and objective tone; demonstrates a strong understanding of disciplinary conventions.
Conclusion is missing or does not relate to the argument.
Conclusion is weak and does not effectively summarize or support the argument.
Conclusion is present but adds little to the overall argument.
Conclusion summarizes the main points but does not fully support the argument.
Conclusion effectively summarizes and supports the argument presented.
Conclusion is insightful and provides a strong, memorable ending that reinforces the argument.
